Description: Long fragment torn from edge of undyed, medium quality linen sack(?); tape sewn to edge for re-inforcement with older scraps of linen adhering from earlier use; bitumen(?) stains; final use as mummy-wrapping. Two layers of plain linen, A, sewn together along selvedges. The seam of A is turned back on itself and bound with a tape of coarser basket weave linen, B, sewn to sack A as a reinforcement; on the inside are traces of a finer linen cloth, C, dating from a previous use. At one end is a complete original corner with a sewn loop. The weave of A is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun (in places on the warp, tightly S-spun); the stitch gauge is warp c.12 ends per 10mm and weft c.9 picks per 10mm. The original seam joining the selvedges, overcasting in S-spin, Z-ply linen thread. B is sewn to A in a hemming stitch, with similar thread. The weave pf B is plain [warp-faced extended tabby] and the threads are S-spun; the stitch gauge is warp c.16 ends per 10mm and weft c.4-5 groups of 3 thread per 10mm. The weave of C is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun; the stitch gauge is warp c.20 ends per 10mm and weft c.12 picks per 10mm.
